update.description:
* add max acceleration to wheels

* add front/rear camera frames and sensors

* add IMU and lidar

* controllers for the head joints

* add rviz and rqt configuration files

* fix(ate) arm links

* publish caster wheel joints state

Note: the robot doesn't drive straight anymore (rotation on the spot works well though), the Z pose of all the wheels collision is the same so I'm not sure why wheels only sporadically contact with the floor. The wheels use spheres as collision shapes but are attached to only 1 axis rotation joints, so maybe that's part of the issue
update.title: Add sensors and controllers

content.raw: This is in a good state, let's get it in!
content.html: This is in a good state, let's get it in!

content.raw: We could add a plot with IMU values to the RQT dashboard, I did it locally but for some reason when I try to rearrange the docks RQT is crashing. We can leave this as an open task, not a blocker.
content.html: We could add a plot with IMU values to the RQT dashboard, I did it locally but for some reason when I try to rearrange the docks RQT is crashing. We can leave this as an open task, not a blocker.

content.raw: yeah eventually I just needed to move forward XD
content.html: yeah eventually I just needed to move forward XD

content.raw: I love it how the robot always falls standing up, we should revisit this if we have time :smile:
content.html: I love it how the robot always falls standing up, we should revisit this if we have time

content.raw:
Just pushed some more fixups, sorry @chapulina for messing up you review.
I also made the simulation "unpaused" by default so I'll update the instructions accordingly as well
content.html: Just pushed some more fixups, sorry @chapulina for messing up you review. I also made the simulation "unpaused" by default so I'll update the instructions accordingly as well

content.raw: We should add this to the erb
content.html: We should add this to the erb

content.raw: Sounds good. Feel free to start a separate page and maybe link to it if you think that makes sense. It would also be nice to explain how to launch these separately, for example, the teleop kinda gets lost in the error messages when spawned together
content.html: Sounds good. Feel free to start a separate page and maybe link to it if you think that makes sense. It would also be nice to explain how to launch these separately, for example, the teleop kinda gets lost in the error messages when spawned together

content.raw: Yeah, I wanted to check with you if this was too granular or not. Once the Pr approved I'll update the wiki accordingly (y)
content.html: Yeah, I wanted to check with you if this was too granular or not. Once the Pr approved I'll update the wiki accordingly (y)

content.raw: Could you add a note about these parameters and their default values to the wiki? Maybe to the [walkthrough](#!/osrf/servicesim/wiki/Walkthrough)?
content.html: Could you add a note about these parameters and their default values to the wiki? Maybe to the walkthrough?
